relations.target: torture: the deliberate, systematic, or wanton infliction of physical or mental suffering by one or more persons in an attempt to force another person to yield information or to make a confession or for any other reason; 'it required unnatural torturing to extract a confession' <i37620>
board: a flat piece of material designed for a special purpose; 'he nailed boards across the windows' <i50876>
water: a liquid necessary for the life of most animals and plants; 'he asked for a drink of water' <i79021>

senses.definition: torture where water is poured over the face of a captive simulating drowning
